security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill (SKILL.md) providing metadata and prompt templates for GitHub Copilot MCP server integration. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access is present. Pure documentation skill with no security concerns.

content.user_title: Access GitHub Copilot AI tools via MCP
content.value_statement: This skill provides direct access to GitHub Copilot AI models through Model Context Protocol tools. Use it for code review, debugging, refactoring, and test generation without leaving your AI coding assistant.
actual_capabilities: Ask Copilot general coding questions with context and model selection
Review code with focus on security, performance, and best practices
Explain code snippets with detailed analysis
Generate unit tests for existing code in multiple frameworks
Get CLI command suggestions for specific tasks
limitations: Usage counts towards Copilot API limits
MCP server must be properly configured
Requires Copilot CLI authentication on the system

use_cases.title: Professional code review
use_cases.description: Get detailed code reviews focusing on security, performance, and maintainability with specific focus areas

use_cases.title: Error troubleshooting
use_cases.description: Debug code errors with context-aware analysis and receive actionable fixes and explanations

use_cases.title: Test generation
use_cases.description: Generate unit tests for existing code using frameworks like Jest, pytest, or Mocha

prompt_templates.title: Ask coding question
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask Copilot how to implement a REST API endpoint for user authentication with JWT tokens

prompt_templates.title: Review code security
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for security vulnerabilities and SQL injection risks: [paste code]

prompt_templates.title: Debug error message
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug this code with error: [error message]. Code: [paste code]

prompt_templates.title: Generate tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Jest unit tests for this function: [paste code]

output_examples.input: Review this code for security issues: function login(u, p) { return db.query('SELECT * WHERE u=' + u + ' AND p=' + p); }
output: CRITICAL: SQL Injection Vulnerability - user input is directly concatenated into SQL query
RECOMMENDATION: Use parameterized queries or an ORM
HIGH: Password passed in plain text - hash and salt passwords
MEDIUM: No rate limiting on login attempts

best_practices: Be specific in prompts and provide relevant context
Choose appropriate model based on task complexity
Use session management for related queries to maintain context
anti_patterns: Using overly broad prompts like 'write code' without specifics
Overusing powerful models for simple tasks
Mixing unrelated queries in a single session

faq.question: Which AI models are supported?
faq.answer: Claude Sonnet 4.5, Claude Opus 4.5, Claude Haiku 4.5, Gemini 3 Pro, GPT-5 family, and GPT-5.1 Codex models

faq.question: What is the request limit?
faq.answer: Usage counts towards your GitHub Copilot API limits. GPT-5 mini has unlimited usage for Pro+ subscribers

faq.question: How do I configure the MCP server?
faq.answer: Configure MCP server in your client settings. Requires GitHub Copilot CLI authentication and proper MCP configuration

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Code is sent to GitHub Copilot for processing. Review GitHub Copilot privacy terms for data handling details

faq.question: What if MCP server is unavailable?
faq.answer: Check GitHub Copilot CLI authentication, verify MCP server configuration, and restart your MCP client

faq.question: How is this different from copilot-flow?
faq.answer: This provides direct tool access. Use copilot-flow-integration skill for structured workflows with additional orchestration
